column4: my husband has kubuntu 8.04 .. i didnt realize he had downgraded so far. i tried to upgrae his flash and broke it. is there something that will tell me how 1. to back up his stuff to another box/ drive  2. do whatever to prepare his drive. 3. get 10.04 and 4. get his stuff back on it?
You should back up ~/ and /etc -- That's it.
ty
That does not look clean/new? "#AllowUsers chull llhull warp craig"
one of those is what i'm trying to use
Are you and that hubby on local network? Not behind a router?
there's a router but i can ping him and i can ssh to his other drives
I'm so sorry. Tools like ssh are meant to make life easier for everybody. You got the short stick. :(
Meh. Not really. Seems like you're able to ssh but receive wrong password. Could try "sudo dpkg-reconfigure openssh-server" -- Otherwise, I don't know what else to say.
ill try that, thanks :)
Try creating a new password "passwd chull" on the machine you're trying to ssh in -- and use the new password. See if that works.
Or was it craig.
craig's box .. i'll go there and try those
Do "passwd craig" -- Generate a new password for sudo. See if you can ssh in with new password.
http://chalcedony.pastebin.com/6sVqjNSD
Try "mv ~/.ssh ~/.ssh-bak" -- This is ridiculous. :(
(On the client).
(Craigs)
Is Craig / chull able to ssh itself in with the new password?
isn't it lovely?
Ha. killall seems to be excessive act.
